Created by adding sisal twine (Sneak + R: Created by adding sisal twine (Sneak + RMB) to an empty metal candle mold.
craftinginfo-toolmaking-text:
Primitive Toolmaking

Immersion Tool Making 101. Only here on The Immersion Mod.

In the immersion mod, hafted flint or stone (e.g. granite) tools are created outside the crafting grid. You will create them step by step on a workspace block in front of you. You will need a flint tool/weapon head, a shaft, and binding material to attach the tool or weapon head to the shaft. The first step is to create the tool head using the knapping interface. If you wish to make a tool or weapon using a head that you prepared ahead of time, or you found by panning, Shift (Sneak) + Right click will allow you to place the flint head and create a workspace. Once the head is made or placed, it will remain on the block where you knapped or placed it, which will become your workspace. Next, you will need to add a shaft, either debarked very thin branch or large bone. Right click the workspace to add the shaft to your knapped flint or stone head. The last step is to secure the shaft to the tool/weapon head using sisal twine, sinew or leather strips. Right click the workspace to add the binding and complete your tool. The completed tool will stay on the workspace block until you Left click (break) and pick it up.

Congratulations! You are now a master Tool Maker \o/
craftinginfo-preserving-text:
Food Preserving

Immersion Food Preserving 101. To dry fruit: place a sisal rug on a solid surface in direct sunlight. With fresh fruit in the active hand (Sneak + RMB) on the rug. (Small rug holds 16 fresh fruit, medium holds 32 and large holds 64). Over time, the berries will dry in the sun. Sun-dried berries appear darker and can be harvested using RMB. To dry meat, prepare salted meat using a mixing bowl. Place the bowl and add raw meat (Sneak + RMB), then add salt to the bowl. Remove salted meat by holding RMB and place on a Drying Rack in direct sunlight using (Sneak + RMB). Sun-dried meat can be removed from racks (RMB) and stored. To make Pemmican, prepare dried meat and dried fruit flours from Sun-dried ingredients using a Quern or Mortar and Pestle. Choose a bowl size based on portions: small bowl holds 4, medium holds 8 and large holds 16. Place a mixing bowl and add equal portions of ingredients using (Sneak + RMB) in this order: dry meat flour, dry fruit flour, fat and bowls of honey. After adding the ingredients, package the pemmican using (Sneak + RMB) with the container in the active hand.

Congratulations! You are now a master Food Preserver \o/
craftinginfo-immersivecrafting-text:
In World Crafting

Crafting items, blocks and containers (objects) using this mechanic requires players to assemble the object through the step-wise addition of components on a workspace block. Wherever possible, crafting performed within the player's grid has been changed to the immersive mechanic, and the Vanilla grid recipes do not function. General Crafting Directions: Placing the first component on a solid block creates a workspace (RMB). Workspaces can be created on any block where a player could knap stones or form clay in vanilla. All subsequent components are added using (Sneak + RMB). Each successful component addition is accompanied by a visual change in the object. When a crafting recipe specifies 'add 4 components', one addition step adds all 4 items from the player's inventory. The player does not need to add each component individually (Sneak + RMB X 4). When the object is complete, breaking the object completes the crafting process. No additional components can be added once the block is broken. Replacing the block or container activates the object for use. Substituting a component that is not specified in the recipe (debarked branch for a barked branch) will result in the creation of a different item than the player intends to build. Changing the order of component addition will also change the item creation. When building an item, if attempting to add a component that is not permitted in the recipe, nothing will happen when using (Sneak + RMB). Check the crafting directions again and make sure the chosen component is allowable. Good Luck and happy crafting!

itemdesc-bow-simple: A little better than a flimsy stick. Craft the limb using a knife and stick. Combine with bowstring to create a carved bow.
itemdesc-bow-carved: A little better than a flimsy stick.  Made by combining a carved limb with a bowstring. Replace bowstring before it breaks and destroys the bow.
itemdesc-bow-composite: A real bow with good stopping power. Craft using a carved limb, glue, horn slab, and sinew. Combine with bowstring to create a composite bow. Replace bowstring before it breaks and destroys the bow.
itemdesc-bow-recurve: Well worth the time and effort to create. Craft using a composite limb, glue, horn slab, sinew and raw hide. Combine with bowstring to create a recurve bow. Replace bowstring before it breaks and destroys the bow.
